Title: Data Analyst, Performance Marketing
Description:
Bumble Inc. is the parent company of Bumble, Badoo, Fruitz and Official. The Bumble platform enables people to build healthy and equitable relationships, through kind connections. Founded by CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014, Bumble was one of the first dating apps built with women at the center and connects people across dating (Bumble Date), friendship (Bumble BFF) and professional networking (Bumble Bizz). Badoo, which was founded in 2006, is one of the pioneers of web and mobile dating products. Fruitz, founded in 2017, encourages open and honest communication of dating intentions through playful fruit metaphors. Official is an app for couples that promotes open and honest communication between partners and was founded in 2020.

Bumble Inc. is seeking an experienced User Acquisition Analyst to work with our paid marketing stakeholders, take an integrated ecosystem approach and support critical business decisions across all our apps. This is a unique opportunity for an experienced analyst who enjoys the fast-paced environment of a growing company, has experience in marketing and has a passion to contribute to helping the Bumble Inc. mission to foster kind connections.

You would ideally have an extensive background in marketing analytics at an app-based tech company, with proven experience in driving commercial impact through applying analytics to critical business problems.

You bring the experience of working with complex sources of Paid Marketing data and use that knowledge to partner with stakeholders and senior leaders, taking a holistic approach to finding answers. You understand the high-level business model of the company and the primary drivers and output metrics to efficiently receive a stakeholder request, draft a project/insights brief and proactively ask for additional scope clarity where necessary.

Remaining laser-focused on the "so what" of the findings, and how the insights support business decisions you take an integrated perspective to analytics, consider all the potential drivers to a problem, review existing knowledge and bring in expertise for advice from other teams. You are passionate about continual improvement, both personally and for the team around you, you always look for feedback to strive for high quality of deliverables.




What you'll do:
You will contribute to data quality as it relates to the Paid Marketing domain, proactively working with Data and Analytics Engineering and other teams to improve data collection and modelling
You will build and manage self-serve data products, a knowledge base of insights, and provide direct support, to empower others to fully understand the value of data in their day-to-day work
You will deliver analytical roadmaps to support the longer-term vision of marketing measurement within the business. This includes reporting, handling of ad-hoc requests and data visibility, experimentation, and ongoing measurement of marketing campaigns
You will optimise and improve SKAN ETL pipelines and refine conversion value methodologies to ensure accurate and robust data collection and analysis
You will build, maintain, and interpret LTV prediction and ROAS calculations to optimise user acquisition campaigns
You will stay up-to-date with the industry and privacy trends, the paid UA landscape, and emerging technologies in data science and engineering





About you:
Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome
3+ years of experience in data science and analytics preferably in Paid Marketing and User Acquisition domains with a strong understanding of multiple tactics, including Churn, LTV, ROAS
Preference for experience working in similar dating/social/gaming tech product industries or else app-based product, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience
You have a background working with complex data infrastructures and experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases
Strong experience with SQL and Python, Looker or a similar visualisation platform. Familiarity with DBT is a plus
You have experience setting up experimentation, measurement, and data collection in the marketing domain
You keep an eye out on the industry, understanding how the wider dating industry influences our business strategies








Global benefits

Maven Fertility We offer a $10,000 lifetime benefit opportunity to all employees and their partners around the world. This benefit can be used to support your reproductive journey - from abortion care and related travel costs to fertility treatment, egg-freezing, adoption, surrogacy, and more. 

Family & compassionate paid leaveFamily leave to support you and your loved ones when needed (including victim of domestic abuse or violent crime).

26 weeks parental leave 26 weeks paid leave for the primary caregiver following the birth, adoption, surrogacy or foster care of a child. The secondary caregiver will also receive 26 weeks paid leave after 1 year of employment.

Unlimited paid time offTake the time you need when you need it. 

Company-wide week offTwice a year, we have a company-wide week off (it’s essential for some teams to continue working and they will be offered alternative time off instead).

Focus FridaysTwice a month we have a no meeting, no deadline, no email and no Slack rule on a Friday so you can focus without distraction.

Check out more of our local benefits here.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

WALT Labs, a leading managed service provider, is dedicated to empowering businesses by harnessing the power of cloud technology. Our team specializes in delivering customized solutions tailored to meet the unique needs of our clients, driving growth and operational efficiency across industries. From supporting small businesses with seamless data migration to enabling large corporations to manage complex infrastructure projects, we provide exceptional service while staying at the forefront of cloud technology advancements.




Role Description

This is a full-time on-site role 3 days a week minimum, for a Data Analyst at WALT Labs in London Kings Cross. The Data Analyst will be responsible for day-to-day tasks such as data analytics, data modeling, and utilizing statistical methods to drive business insights in Looker Studio and Looker Core. Effective communication skills will play a key role in collaborating with cross-functional teams.




Qualifications

Analytical Skills, Data Analytics, and Data Modeling abilities
Proficiency in Statistics
Experience using Looker Studio at minimum
Strong Communication skills
Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Statistics, Data Analytics, Computer Science)
Experience in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Python, R)
Ability to work effectively in a team environment







Responsibilities




Collect, clean, and optimize datasets in BigQuery or other SQL databases for analysis and reporting.
Use SQL to query large datasets and uncover trends that support business decisions.
Design, build, and maintain Looker dashboards, including custom LookML models.
Optimize queries and visualizations for cost efficiency and performance improvement.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather reporting requirements and present actionable insights.
Ensure data privacy, security, and compliance with governance policies.
Troubleshoot and resolve data discrepancies and support Looker or SQL database-related issues.
Monitor and automate reporting for business-critical KPIs.
Stay updated on best practices and recommend process improvements for data analysis and visualization.




This role combines technical skills in SQL and Looker with strategic analysis to drive data-driven decisions.




Salary

Between £30,000 - £45,000 depending on experience




Benefits

20 holiday days + bank holidays (earn 1.5 days every 3 years)
Private health insurance

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to support our data-driven decision-making processes. The ideal candidate will have strong technical skills in data analysis, experience with data visualization tools, and the ability to communicate complex insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. You will sit within the data team, and work closely with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and deliver data solutions that enhance overall performance.

WHAT YOU'LL WORK ON


Data Collection & Preparation: Gather, clean, and organize large datasets from multiple sources to ensure accuracy, consistency, and completeness.
Data Analysis: Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
Reporting & Visualization: Create clear, actionable, and visually appealing reports and dashboards using Tableau
Data Modelling: Build and maintain data models to support ongoing analysis and reporting needs.
Collaboration: Work with business stakeholders to understand data needs, and provide insights that support strategic initiatives.
Automation: Develop automated reports and data processes to improve efficiency and reduce manual work.
Performance Metrics: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure business performance and identify areas for improvement.
Presentations & Storytelling: Present findings to management and key stakeholders through presentations and clear data storytelling.


WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


At least 2-3 years professional experience developing advanced Tableau data visualisations, dashboards and reporting. (Essential)
Skills in exploratory data analysis and familiarity with advanced quantitative analysis. (Essential)
Strong ability to interpret and analyse data to provide actionable insights. (Essential)
Comfortable using modern data technologies. Familiarity with database modelling and data warehousing principles.
Familiarity with automated data ingestion processes including APIs.
Ability to partner effectively with data science and engineering stakeholders to meet the data needs of the business, translating business needs into analytical requirements.
Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner.
Excellent written, verbal, presentation and communication skills.
Self-motivated and proactive with proven creative, problem-solving, and critical thinking capabilities.
Ability to adapt to changing circumstances and are open to new ideas and approaches.
Who is willing to learn (what are likely to be new tools and programmes).
Work effectively in teams, respect diverse perspectives, and contribute positively to group dynamics. A willingness to support and motivate colleagues is highly valued.
Willingness to be creative and innovative to suggest new ideas for insights and product possibilities.


WHAT WE OFFER


eMed flex-leave
5% employer pension contribution for 5% employee contribution
Life Insurance 4x annual base salary
Health cash plan
Employee Assistance Program
Eye care voucher reimbursement (up to £20)
Enhanced Maternity, Paternity and Adoption pay.
Health & Wellbeing resources
Up to £80 towards noise cancelling headphones


This role is based in our London Head Office 5 days per week.

WORKING AT EMED

Whether you work in one of our amazing offices, clinics or part of our remote clinician workforce, eMed is highly collaborative and fun! You’ll have a chance to work in a fast-paced environment with experienced industry leaders. We have a learning environment where you can make an impact.

WHO WE ARE

At eMed our people aren’t just part of a team, they’re part of something bigger. We’re a vibrant community of creative thinkers and doers, forging the way for a new generation of healthcare. We’re only as good as our people. So, finding the best people is everything to us. We serve millions, but we choose our people one at a time…

DIVERSITY

We believe that difference inspires a better, healthier world. That’s why it’s at the heart of everything we do. From our people to our products, difference enriches every part of our business and creates a culture based on equality of opportunity, and in which all employees can progress their careers. We’re committed to creating an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, pregnancy status, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Pine Walk

Pine Walk Capital is a business platform helping insurance teams to grow. Pine Walk provides a wrap-around set of support functions and delivers best in class service across executive management, consultancy, finance, compliance, and IT. Pine Walk works with highly motivated niche insurance teams that deal in complicated and innovative transactions. Pine Walk is on a high growth trajectory which is giving rise to opportunities and new roles across the team.




Job Summary

This role offers an exciting opportunity to fast-track your career in an aggressively ambitious business. The role’s broad scope provides high exposure to the business, visibility over Group processes and systems, and exposure to and collaboration with highly skilled professionals.




The primary purpose of the role is to design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database architectures to solve business problems. This includes writing and maintaining efficient SQL code for data retrieval, manipulation, and reporting, as well as automating recurring database tasks. The role also involves performance tuning, ensuring data integrity, and managing datasets to optimise database performance and scalability. You'll collaborate closely with other developers and teams to integrate SQL solutions with applications and ensure seamless data flow.




Location

Pine Walk is part of the wider Fidelis Partnership Group – with offices across London, Belgium, Ireland, and Bermuda. This role will be based in the Croydon office with 1x day per week in the London City office.




Key Responsibilities

1. Create, optimise, and maintain SQL queries and stored procedures for efficient data retrieval, manipulation, and reporting.

2. Analyse and optimise database performance through indexing, query optimisation, and other techniques to ensure high efficiency and scalability.

3. Work with third parties to deliver integrations that are robust and effective, to reduce manual processing/re-keying of data.

4. Automate recurring database processes such as data imports, exports, and scheduled jobs to improve workflow efficiency.

5. Analyse data to provide both reports and insight using a range of technologies including SQL, Python and Power Platform.

6. Document and demonstrate solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, etc.

7. Manage data collection processes with the MGA’s or third parties – ensuring processes are documented and data is delivered to an appropriate level of quality.

8. Manage and review the tasks of the junior data analysts – developing into the line manager for junior data analysts.

9. Working with the rest of the Pine Walk data team ensure that infrastructures and environments are appropriately sized and structured.

10. Any other duties assigned by your line manager relevant to the role/time.




Our Stack

Pine Walk works completely in the cloud to ensure we are flexible and ready for growth. Our Datawarehouse is built on Azure SQL combining data from third party databases and our own apps. The Power Platform is our reporting tool of choice alongside Excel but given the types of insurance involved other areas of data analysis and system design, e.g. Python, GIS, will need to be integrated into our solutions in the future.




Pine Walk is committed to exploring new technologies to automate processes and deliver effective working processes.




Essential Skills, Knowledge, and Experience

• Degree educated (minimum 2:1) in a numerate subject.

• Prior experience in SQL ( preferably 2+ years)

• Strong written and spoken communication skills to enable communication at all levels.

• Ability to handle a varied workload and competing priorities.

• Strong analytical, research and reporting skills.

• Intermediate proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel, Word, and

PowerPoint.

• Proven ability to follow instructions and work diligently to create solutions based on

provided specifications.




Competencies and behaviours

• Proactive and solutions orientated.

• Analytical with a strong attention to detail.

• Detail-orientated with excellent problem-solving skills.

• Personal drive and resilience in established and new/changing situations.

• Ability to support success and timely delivery in a complex, multi-disciplinary environment.

• A team player with strong interest in the performance of the wider business.

• Commercially savvy, bright, energetic, and positive with a ‘can do’ attitude and a focus on getting things done.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mobica | Be Extraordinary_



Mobica helps businesses build pioneering experiences for their customers. Headquartered in Manchester UK with offices across Europe and US, we partner with businesses across multiple industries - from aerospace to finance and semiconductors to automotive - providing them with access to incredible talent and engineering expertise across the entire technology stack



Mobica Way



Well-known Clients and Projects focused on the Technologies of Tomorrow - our work is already all around you. Almost all of our long term customers are instantly recognisable global brands developing some of the most interesting products and services you are using today and will use in the future. Our expertly crafted software underpins many of today’s amazing customer experiences. When you join us, you'll be both challenged and supported, and you'll be a part of something extraordinary.
Empowered Mobicans driving their own careers – we empower our people to develop their skills and move forward in their careers. Our people are treated like partners, are encouraged to share knowledge and push the boundaries. We are there to help you with the opportunities to advance, learn and grow.
Ideas are prioritised over Hierarchy and Biases - in Mobica you are listened to and valued. We are building open communication and a safe environment. We've made it our mission to create a working environment where all team members feel welcome, protected from discrimination and have access to equal opportunities.
We believe that employees should be happy – Mobica is a place where talented minds are recognised, nurtured and valued. We are early adopters of the hybrid working practices, you define the way where you work more productive - at home or in the office - we will create the environment for that. In addition to the competitive salary you are getting access to a range of virtual, offline and on-site events and platforms where you can learn, brainstorm, challenge, express yourself or simply have some fun and get new friends. Fruit and snacks are in the office to make your mood good.


Job Description



We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst to join our team and help shape the integration of new businesses and enhanced activities into global operations. This role combines business acumen with technical expertise to deliver innovative data solutions and drive operational excellence.



Key Responsibilities:



Business Integration & Process Design:
Combine business understanding with logical data modeling and process design to integrate new Trading & Supply (T&S) businesses into global operations.



System Understanding:
Gain in-depth knowledge of key Align Energy Trading and Risk Management Systems (ETRMs), focusing on system interactions with Risk tools in the regional context.



Market Risk Analytics:
Analyze pre- and post-deal market risk metrics, including Value at Risk (VaR), Scenario Analysis, Stress Testing, Risk Metric reporting, and PnL Explained reporting.



Credit Risk Analytics:
Assess credit risk on pre- and post-deal bases, covering Potential Future Exposure (PFE), portfolio analytics, Expected Credit Loss (ECL), Credit Value Adjustment (CVA), credit reserves, and cost of credit analysis.



Collaboration & Support:
Work closely with Commercial, Credit, Market Risk, and Valuation teams, supporting production reporting and leading transformation projects.



Solution Design:
Link technical solutions with business requirements, capturing business challenges and creating functional/non-functional requirements (e.g., security, usability, and supportability).





Qualifications


Proven expertise in data analysis, business modeling, and process improvement.
Strong knowledge of market and credit risk analytics.
Familiarity with Energy Trading and Risk Management Systems (ETRMs).
Ability to create clear documentation and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to assess risks and business impacts.

Title: TikTok LIVE Data Analyst
Description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. Our focus is to continually champion and optimize TikTok LIVE through working with creators to ensure a creative, fun and safe space for all of our users.

The Regional LIVE Operation Strategy Team leads various cross-functional projects. Our key initiatives include developing strategic plans to drive widespread adoption of LIVE at scale among creators, localizing new product features, creating user engagement strategies, ensuring a positive creator experience through education on the Community Guidelines and best practices, and providing ad hoc analysis and support to cross-functional partners.

Responsibilities:
- Analyzing local and global trends to help improve performance within the EU LIVE team
- Creating and preparing reports and dashboards to help us better identify areas of focus and trends within our ecosystem

Examples of Problems You'll Be Solving:
- What are the best content verticals for us to focus our creator recruitment on?
- Building a prediction model for identifying creators who may be destined for success on our platform
- Which metrics and leading and lagging indicators should we use for our key OKRs?
- How should we best segment our creators and users to have a more meaningful impact on their growth?
- What are the best touchpoints to educate our creators, and when should we activate this education?
- Using statistical tools to simplify complex data sets, helping us better diagnose issues and propose solutions

Title: Graduate Data Analyst - London
Description:
Job Position: Graduate Data Analyst (Engineer/Scientist) - via the Graduate Development Programme   

Locations: London

Starting Salary: £28,000  

Application Requirements:


Minimum 2:1 or above in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) subject
Experience in analysing data
Right to work in the UK unsponsored for the duration of the programme
Ability to work on site 5 days a week.



Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants. 

Grayce specialises in driving change and transformation for some of the world's most ambitious organisations. For over a decade, we've partnered with FTSE 100 and 250 companies to deliver impactful results by developing and deploying high-performing talent in the UK and beyond.

Our Accelerated Development Programme is designed to launch the careers of recent graduates eager to make an impact. We offer a fast-track route to expertise, allowing you to gain hands-on experience with one of our impressive clients in a variety of flexible roles such as Data Analysis, InfoSec, Software Testing and DevOps.

Join Grayce and accelerate your career!

Why Grayce?

Our Analysts are actively involved in major global transformation programmes across diverse industries.

Opportunity: You'll embark on a journey of continuous learning, gaining industry-accredited qualifications, whilst getting hands-on experience working full time on site directly with prestigious FTSE100, 250, and 500 organisations.

Delivery: You will work with one client, delivering high quality outcomes during your Grayce tenure, before transitioning to working directly for them. The skills required for exceptional client delivery include natural curiosity, proactivity, adaptability, effective communication and problem solving.

Mentoring: Thrive under the guidance of our experienced Delivery Managers and Technical Trainers. They'll be your go-to, offering support, insights, sharing experiences.

Progression: Starting as an Analyst with the potential for significant salary progression, you will pick up invaluable skills and complete a minimum of 6 industry recognised accreditations during your time on the development programme.

What Makes a Great Grayce Analyst

2:1 Undergraduate Degree: An undergraduate degree with a minimum 2:1 within in a STEM field. A solid academic basis within data analysis and science through an additional MSc would be an advantage.

Data Tools: Previous experience with tools such as Excel, R, SQL or Python are an essential for this role. If you have utilised visualisation programmes such as Tableau or Power BI in projects before, we are also keen to hear from you.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.

Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at £28,000 with potential for significant growth

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title - Data Analyst

Location - Oxford (Hybrid)




About the client

We are working with an established, well-funded AI drug discovery company at the forefront of revolutionising how treatments are discovered, tested, and developed. With a growing presence worldwide, they’re expanding their Oxford-based AI & Data team and looking for talented individuals passionate about combining data with life sciences to fuel breakthroughs in drug discovery, climate change, sustainable agriculture and government innovation.




Role Overview

The data analyst must have a love for attention to detail and be excited by data management. This is a hands-on role but will also contribute to strategic acquisition and platform positions, supporting business growth and decision-making. You will join an industry-leading team of AI researchers, applied AI scientists, and data and software engineers with a real passion for building a better tomorrow for us all.




The ideal candidate will have strong analytical capabilities with deep industry experience and the ability to bridge the gap between business context and data analysis. As we are building out the team from scratch, we are open to speaking to candidates with varying levels of experience so please apply if your experience aligns with the requirements listed below.




This is an incredibly unique opportunity to join a technology institute, on a mission to build sustainable change in the world, through accelerating innovation by driving scientific and technological advancements.




Responsibilities

Design, implement and optimise data collection processes to gather relevant and high-quality data for various projects within the domains of climate tech, health, energy, sustainable farming
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data is accurately captured from multiple sources, including experimental, clinical, and public datasets
Assess data quality and establish robust data validation procedures to ensure data integrity throughout the analysis pipeline
Develop and apply data quality frameworks tailored to machine learning use cases, focusing on data completeness, accuracy, and reliability
Act as a vital link between engineers, scientists, and the applied AI team, facilitating seamless communication and data flow across the entire drug discovery process
Support interdisciplinary projects by translating complex data requirements into actionable insights and providing clear guidance on data use
Guide the data acquisition strategy based on a comprehensive understanding of industry dynamics, emerging trends, and scientific advancements
Identify new data sources and partnerships that can enhance the company’s data capabilities and contribute to strategic decision-making




Requirements

Bachelor’s or Master’s in Data Science, Statistics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, or a related field. A PhD is a plus
Minimum of 3 years of experience as a data analyst within an elite organisation
Proven track record in handling complex datasets, particularly in the context of drug discovery, biomedical research, agriculture, clean energy, government
Proficiency in data analysis and manipulation tools such as Python, R, and SQL
Experience with data visualisation platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to effectively communicate insights to stakeholders
Experience with data visualisation platforms (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and data quality assessment techniques
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to translate complex data insights for non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying and addressing data-related challenges




What’s on offer

Industry-leading salary compensation DOE
An opportunity to work on projects that will make a difference in the world, all projects are multi-decade programs that are orientated to improve society and people’s lives
A rare opportunity to shape and lead the AI Capability team from the ground up
State-of-the-art resources, enabling you to push the boundaries of AI research and development quickly and ethically




If you’re a data-driven professional passionate about innovation and real-world impact, we encourage you to apply!

PetLab Co. is the world's fastest-growing pet supplement business. Launching in 2018, we successfully achieved a 9-figure revenue in 2023 without any external funding. Our team is vibrant, fast-moving, and customer-driven where high-performers are valued and rewarded. And it is the ideal place for an ambitious, hardworking, animal lover who wants to progress their career rapidly.

Reporting to the Head of Marketplaces and working closely with the Head of Data, you will be joining a small but rapidly growing team of talented data professionals. In this role, you will take the lead in analyzing and optimizing PetLab Co's Amazon activities. By working with large data sets, you will play a key role in driving data-informed decisions that enhance performance on the Amazon marketplace across multiple Geo's.

As this is a newly created position, you'll have considerable autonomy and the opportunity to make a significant impact on the company's approach to data and decision-making

We move and think fast so it's important that you are able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and are happy to roll up your sleeves to do whatever it takes to support the team in every way possible. If that sounds exciting - we would love you to join our pack!

Our tech stack:


Engineering -DBT/Fivetran & Google Cloud
Data Warehouse - Big Query
Visualisation - Power BI
Languages- SQL/Python



Your day to day will look a bit like this:


Lead the development of Amazon analytics and associated data strategies
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Develop and maintain SQL scripts for data analysis and reporting
Comprehend and utilise data points from the various Amazon APIs and Amazon Marketing Cloud (AMC)
Use Python for data manipulation, cleaning, and visualization
Collaborate with Product and Engineering teams to develop and implement new data-driven products and features
Provide regular reports and insights to key stakeholders
Analyse and identify opportunities for optimizing advertising spend for improving efficiency and performance
Create dashboards to allow colleagues to self-serve



Requirements

PetLab Co. is the world's fastest-growing pet supplement business. Launching in 2018, we successfully achieved a 9-figure revenue in 2023 without any external funding.
